intro: Barringtonia rosaria, commonly known as the white cedar or white mangosteen, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Lecanodendraceae and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that bloom at night. The plant produces a fruit that is typically a woody capsule containing several seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. The botanical features of Barringtonia rosaria make it an important species in both ecological and ornamental contexts.
